title: How to Use Mirror Powder on Nails

steps.title: Apply your base coat and two coats of nail polish.
steps.content: Apply your base coat and two coats of nail polish. Be sure to extend the polish over the tips of your nails to make your manicure last longer. You can use any color you want, but mirror power will show up the best against black. UV-gel polish is easier to work with, but it is still possible to get a nice finish on non-UV gel polish and regular nail polish. It will take more work, however. [2] X Expert Source Kristin Pulaski Salon Owner & Nail Specialist Expert Interview. 19 May 2020. Consider covering the skin around your nails with some white school glue or liquid latex to make clean-up easier.

steps.title: Apply some top coat, then wait until it is dry to the touch.
steps.content: Apply some top coat, then wait until it is dry to the touch. Don't let the top coat dry all the way, however. You want it to feel rubbery, but not sticky or tacky. This is important, especially with regular, non-gel top coat; if you apply it too soon, the powder will make a mess, and if you wait too long, the powder won't stick. [3] X Research source Use regular, non-water-based top coat for this. A quick-dry top coat is recommended. Remember to extend the top coat down past the tip.

steps.title: Tap on the mirror powder using a foam eyeshadow brush.
steps.content: Tap on the mirror powder using a foam eyeshadow brush. Start from the cuticle area and work your way towards the tip. You can use a special applicator meant for applying mirror powder, or you can use a foam, eyeshadow brush. Gently flick the brush down as you tap the powder on.

steps.title: Buff the powder into the polish.
steps.content: Buff the powder into the polish. Once you have your nail coated with powder, gently buff the surface with the foam eyeshadow brush. Do not apply too much pressure, or you may create dents. As you continue to buff, the surface will get smoother and smoother.

steps.title: Wipe off any excess powder.
steps.content: Wipe off any excess powder. You can do this using a soft brush, such as an eyeshadow brush or a kabuki brush, or a cotton swab dipped in rubbing alcohol. If you applied glue or liquid latex earlier, simply peel it off.

steps.title: Apply a water-based top coat, making sure to coat the tip of your nail.
steps.content: Apply a water-based top coat, making sure to coat the tip of your nail. Many people find that regular top coat cracks or mars the mirror powder's finish. Luckily, water-based top coat does not do that. [4] X Research source [5] X Research source

steps.title: Finish off with a regular top coat.
steps.content: Finish off with a regular top coat. Once you have applied a water-based top coat, you can safely use any type of top coat. This will make your manicure last even longer; unfortunately, water-based top coat alone does not last very long. [6] X Research source [7] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for your top coat to finish drying.
steps.content: Wait for your top coat to finish drying. Once it is dry, you can show off your new nails to all of your friends.

steps.title: Apply a base coat, and cure it for 30 seconds under an LED manicure lamp.
steps.content: Apply a base coat, and cure it for 30 seconds under an LED manicure lamp. [8] X Research source Some nail artists also recommend coating the skin around your nails with white school glue or liquid latex. This will make cleaning up your manicure easier, because all you have to do is peel the glue or latex off. Be sure to coat the very tips of your nails too. This will prevent the polish from peeling.

steps.title: Add two coats of UV-gel polish, then cure it.
steps.content: Add two coats of UV-gel polish, then cure it. Apply your first coat, then cure it for 30 seconds. Apply your second coat, then cure it for only 15 seconds. [9] X Expert Source Kristin Pulaski Salon Owner & Nail Specialist Expert Interview. 19 May 2020. Remember to coat the tips of your nails too! You can use any color you want, but many people find that black works best.

steps.title: Use a sponge eyeshadow applicator to tap on the powder.
steps.content: Use a sponge eyeshadow applicator to tap on the powder. Don't worry if the powder doesn't look smooth. Simply dip your foam applicator into the powder, and start tapping it onto your nail. Start from the cuticle area, and work your way down towards the tip.

steps.title: Use the applicator to gently buff the powder into your nail.
steps.content: Use the applicator to gently buff the powder into your nail. Once you have your nails coated with powder, use the foam applicator to gently buff the powder into your nails. Do not use too much pressure, however, or you might create dents. As you buff, the finish will get smoother and smoother. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Clean it up with a soft brush or rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Clean it up with a soft brush or rubbing alcohol. Grab an soft, fluffy eyeshadow brush or kabuki brush, and gently sweep the tops of your nails. This will knock off any excess powder. [11] X Research source You can also use a thin brush or cotton swab dipped in rubbing alcohol to wipe down the ski around your nails. [12] X Research source If you applied glue or latex in the beginning, simply peel it off!

steps.title: Apply a no-wipe top coat, and cure it for 30 seconds.
steps.content: Apply a no-wipe top coat, and cure it for 30 seconds. Once your nails have cured, you are ready to rock them!
